instructions: This sheet for Brinkwood is designed to look similar to the paper sheets.
name: Name
detail_dramatic:
Sow chaos and reap the rewards of confusion.
How will you command attention?
detail_subtle:
Remain unnoticed, slip past suspicion.
How will you remain unnoticed?
detail_tactical:
Gain and hold an advantage, ambush cleverly.
How will you gain an advantage?
detail_rapid:
Move quickly, before your opportunity passes.
How will you strike quickly?
detail_cautious:
Plan in meticulous detail, be ready for anything.
How will you prepare?
detail_charismatic:
Win allies or demoralize your foes.
How will you rally others to your cause?
i_blackjack_description: A dull, hefty bludgeoning weapon, also known as a “sap,” these weapons are useful mostly for their silent and non-lethal nature. A favored tool of kidnappers and other rogues, they are highly concealable but illegal if discovered.
i_a_blade_or_two_description: Small daggers, knives, and shortswords are the most common forms of personal defense in Cardenfell. Used more as tools than as weapons, these blades can nevertheless be deadly in the hands of a skilled wielder, but are mostly useful due to their ubiquity and ease of concealment.
i_spear_description: Once the most common weapon to see on a battlefield, owing to it being cheap to produce and simple to wield. Now only desperately poor hunters and outlaws will risk being caught with these illegal weapons, and even they may choose to break and abandon them after a single use rather than keep such contraband on their person.
i_longsword_description: A weapon hearkening back to the Old Kingdom, long blades such as foils, arming swords, and dueling blades have begun to fall out of fashion in favor of pistols and other more advanced weaponry. Nevertheless, they are often useful for fending off multiple foes in melee, especially when used in conjunction with a shield.
i_pistol_description: A very short ranged weapon capable of penetrating most types of armor. Most widely available types of shot are cheaply made and will quickly wear down the gun’s mechanisms, so the danger-prone would be wise to invest in a contact for high quality ammunition. They are often carried in pairs due to the difficulty in reloading a single pistol.
i_rifle_description: Likely the most accurate and deadly weapon in the world, but also the slowest to reload. As is always the case, great power must always come with a cost.
i_crossbow_description: One needs not to be strong, swift, patient, or even terribly precise to wield this deadly ranged weapon with reasonable efficacy; they need only have plenty of time to reload.
i_short_bow_description: These ranged weapons are ideal for firing repeat shots at unarmored targets from a comfortable range. While often thought of as weapons meant for the dexterous, a good deal of strength is needed to use them effectively.
i_hunting_bow_description: Best for shooting animals at under 30 paces, homemade bows aren’t ideal for combat, and despite their limited utility, they are just as illegal as more effective weapons. Some peasants in isolated rural areas will nonetheless risk a possession charge for the sake of making their hunting easier.
i_longbow_description: While it has a greater effective range than other bows, it’s somewhat cumbersome and demanding to wield. Only carried by those intent on ambushing targets from a great distance, or who wish to chase some romantic ideal of traditional brigands.
i_buckler_description: +1d resist. A small shield, easily carried on a belt, with a metal protrusion for deflecting attacks. In a skilled hand it can be effective at parrying blows, but it cannot meaningfully defend against the strikes of heavy weapons or ranged attacks.
i_round_shield_description: +1d resist. While not optimally shaped or weighted, a great hunk of wood is the best choice for one who wants to ensure that a blocked attack will be completely absorbed regardless of the skill or positioning of the blocker.
i_knightly_shield_description: +2d resist. These uniquely shaped wooden shields reinforced with leather are only produced for the upper echelons of the military, and bear the heraldic markings of their rightful owner.
i_leather_armor_description: Soaks 1 harm. Treated leather can absorb impacts quite well, but can only defend against bladed attacks if it suffers a relatively glancing blow, and should only be worn as armor by the swift and brave.
i_chainmail_description: Soaks 1 harm, +1d to resist. While a solid enough hit can pierce through or break apart the chain links, this lightweight metal armor will stand up at least once to a strike from nearly any weapon while still allowing its wearer plenty of maneuverability.
i_plated_jacket_description: Soaks 2 harm. Decent armor that is simple to craft and repair; any scrap metal can be sewn into the interior of a quality coat. Unfortunately, any well aimed thrust or shot can land in between the arrangement of the plates, nullifying the armor’s effectiveness entirely.
i_lantern_description: While most brigands prefer to let their eyes adjust to the darkness rather than risk the attention a light brings, a lantern remains an occasionally useful tool.
i_censer_description: A vessel for burning wood, attached to a sturdy chain. Despite their weaponization by brigands, they have yet to be officially restricted, perhaps in anticipation of resentment from the churches that use them to officiate certain ceremonies, or perhaps for fear of making this utility more popularly known.
i_manna_wood_description: Unknown to all except the fae, who keep track of such things, the foreign sweet flowering manna tree is actually a distant cousin of ashwood. In arrow form, its wood is no different from that of any other tree, and when burned, its smoke has only a fraction of its relative’s potency. It is only the tree’s legal status that makes it an alternative worthy of consideration.
i_burglary_kit_description: A bird call instrument, a set of cleverly disguised lockpicks, a spare set of clothes, some cured meat, a bottle of inhalational anesthetic, and a shuttered lantern all have one or two obvious uses, but a clever thief can find many more than that.
i_tinkering_tools_description: Metal instruments for both detail work and heavy maintenance, an essential chemistry apparatus, and all that is needed to collect and refine certain basic elements make up a tinkerer’s toolkit. The function of any one piece is unlikely to be guessed by the layman, but the intent behind the set as a whole is plainly obvious.
i_demolition_tools_description: Packets of saltpeter, timing mechanisms, and vials of various alchemicals are all essential for making a proper explosion. Typically disguised as fireworks or in smoking pipes, these tools are capable of providing little more than a colorful distraction without an additional key component: black powder.
i_subterfuge_supplies_description: Capes and cloaks are common guards against the cold in Cardenfell, and combined with a bit of coal paint or mud, one can make a reasonably stealthy disguise to guard against detection in the dead of night. Creating more sophisticated costumes able to pass muster at vampiric social events typically requires access either to more fanciful clothing or a talented tailor.
i_climbing_gear_description: Rope, rigging, pitons, and a hammer are common enough in Cardenfell, as being able to climb over the jagged bluffs and hills of the countryside often requires their use. Still, when used in an urban environment, these tools are likely to raise a few eyebrows.
i_ashwood_description: The wood of ash trees can cause grievous harm to vampires, and its smoke can hide one’s presence from their supernatural senses. Ashwood is highly controlled, and carrying arrows of it is a crime punishable by death.
i_black_powder_description: The ideal substance for making bombs and ammunition for firearms, as the much more common saltpeter creates more smoke than it does explosive force, and tends to foul a firearm’s mechanisms quickly.
insight_description: Resist consequences from deception or understanding.
mask_0_desc: Hunt a target; gather information about its location and movements; attack with precision shooting from a distance.
mask_1_desc: Study a person, thing, or tech system with close scrutiny to gather information and apply knowledge.
mask_2_desc: Survey a location or situation to understand what's going on; sense trouble before it happens; gather information about opportunities or exploits.
mask_3_desc: Tinker with mechanisms to create, modify, disable, or repair; disable a trap, pick a lock, or crack a safe. Use analog technology or systems to your advantage.
hunt_description: Hunt a target; gather information about its location and movements; attack with precision shooting from a distance.
study_description: Study a person, thing, or tech system with close scrutiny to gather information and apply knowledge.
survey_description: Survey a location or situation to understand what's going on; sense trouble before it happens; gather information about opportunities or exploits.
tinker_description: Tinker with mechanisms to create, modify, disable, or repair; disable a trap, pick a lock, or crack a safe. Use analog technology or systems to your advantage.
prowess_description: Resist consequences from physical strain or injury.
finesse_description: Finesse an item from someone's pocket; employ subtle misdirection or sleight-of-hand; handle a vehicle or a mount.
prowl_description: Prowl about unseen and traverse obstacles; climb, swim, run, jump, and tumble. Ambush with close violence.
skirmish_description: Skirmish with an opponent in close combat; assault or hold a position; brawl and wrestle.
wreck_description: Wreck a place, item, or obstacle with savage force or carefully applied sabotage; breach defenses with force; create distractions and chaos.
resolve_description: Resist consequences from mental strain or willpower.
attune_description: Attune to your mask, perceive and understand magic, or interact with workings.
command_description: Command obedience with your force of personality; intimidate or threaten; lead an action with one of the crew's gangs.
consort_description: Consort with friends or connections to gain access to resources, information, people, or places.
sway_description: Sway someone with charm, logic, deception, disguise, or bluff; change attitudes or behavior with manipulation or seduction.
team_assistance_desc: Teammate takes 1 stress and describes how they help you
push_yourself_desc: Take 2 Stress or spend 2 Essence or accept a Mask Bargain
xp_top: Mark 1 XP each if you brought into play...
xp_relationship: relationship to your fellow brigands, the rebellion, the masks or the Fae.
mask_bg_overlap: When a Mask Action overlaps with a Background Action, they are in coherence. Roll the lower of the two action ratings to gain +Effect.
essence_blurb1: Spend at least 1 essence to use a Special Ability
essence_blurb3: Spend essence to remove stress at a 1:1 ratio
maskxp_blurb: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 Mask XP or 2 Mask XP if that item occurred multiple times. When the Mask XP clock fills, choose a new Special Ability or add a new Mask Dot.
mask_multifaceted_desc: Gain an ability from a different Mask.
deceive_desc: When you Deceive, you use lies and trickery to coerce others.
hide_desc: When you Hide, you veil people, intentions, or plots.
reveal_desc: When you Reveal, you discover what was hidden.
educate_desc: When you Educate, you teach, elucidate, or hold forth a topic.
corrupt_desc: When you Corrupt, you use your blood as a weapon.
crack_desc: When you Crack, you force a small but critical break.
quarry_desc: When you Quarry, you strengthen, reinforce, or hunt.
spoil_desc: When you Spoil, you rot from within or ruin plans.
frighten_desc: When you Frighten, you instill fear into others.
awe_desc: When you Awe, you create a spectacle of wonder.
disarm_desc: When you Disarm, you remove an enemy’s ability to do harm.
explode_desc: When you Explode, you use your emotions or literal explosive devices to make things go boom.
slaughter_desc: When you Slaughter, you use close, personal violence.
carnage_desc: When you sow Carnage, you fight at a distance.
direct_desc: When you Direct, you command others in the heat of battle.
cover_desc: When you Cover, you use violence to protect your comrades.
rouse_desc: When you Rouse, you inspire people to take action.
burn_desc: When you Burn, you set fire.
inspire_desc: When you Inspire, you fill hearts with passion or purpose.
provoke_desc: When you Provoke, your enemies do things they shouldn’t.
exsanguinate_desc: When you Exsanguinate, you draw blood or strength from another.
vivisect_desc: When you Vivisect, you use quick, precise blade strikes.
suture_desc: When you Suture, you repair people or things.
tend_desc: When you Tend, you care for your comrade’s needs.
snipe_desc: When you Snipe, you shoot at targets from long range.
scout_desc: When you Scout, you move ahead to gather intelligence.
read_desc: When you Read, you read and interpret writing or situations.
slip_desc: When you Slip, you quietly fade away.
mask_lies_desc: The eldest, the deceiver, the bringer of light
mask_lies_deceive_desc: When you Deceive, you use lies and trickery to coerce others.
mask_lies_hide_desc: When you Hide, you veil people, intentions, or plots.
mask_lies_reveal_desc: When you Reveal, you discover what was hidden.
mask_lies_educate_desc: When you Educate, you teach, elucidate, or hold forth a topic.
mask_lies_manyfaces_desc: If you are able to get a single drop of blood from someone, you may expend 2 essence to change your face to match theirs.
mask_lies_simpletruths_desc: Gain +Effect when countering propaganda or exposing some commonly accepted lie.
mask_lies_honeyedwords_desc: When using lies or flattery to influence your enemies, gain +1d or +Effect.
mask_lies_unseenunheard_desc: You may expend Special Armor to cancel any consequence that would lead to your discovery.
mask_lies_tastetruths_desc: If you are able to drink a dram of blood from a person, you may gather information about their past, seeing some of their life through their eyes.
mask_lies_twistthelie_desc: When you catch an enemy in a lie, you immediately harm them for 2 ticks on a relevant clock or with a -1 to their total threat.
mask_lies_cloakrumors_desc: Spend 1 essence and use the Deceive action to whisper a “rumor” in someone’s ear. They will believe that rumor and most likely act on it for the next hour.
mask_lies_xp: You taught someone else something or learned something important.
mask_ruin_desc: A slow death creeps towards the oppressor
mask_ruin_corrupt_desc: When you Corrupt, you use your blood as a weapon.
mask_ruin_crack_desc: When you Crack, you force a small but critical break.
mask_ruin_quarry_desc: When you Quarry, you strengthen, reinforce, or hunt.
mask_ruin_spoil_desc: When you Spoil, you rot from within or ruin plans.
mask_ruin_alchemicblood_desc: You may infuse your blood with one of the following effects and use its power to augment your magic. You may unlock additional effects by spending additional advancements.
mask_ruin_envenom_desc: You may apply the effect of your blood to a weapon for a scene.
mask_ruin_aslowpoison_desc: If you poison an enemy or mark them with your blood, they cannot hide from you. You may always sense and track them. Gain +Effect when harming your quarry.
mask_ruin_transfusion_desc: You may reverse the effects of Corrupt, temporarily granting your allies potency.
mask_ruin_cruelend_desc: When your poison kills someone, it does so horrifically, terrifying your foes and increasing your position.
mask_ruin_bulwark_desc: Gain +1d to all resistance rolls when leading a cohort.
mask_ruin_oldstone_desc: You can gather information about a place by touching shaped stone, mortar, or brickwork.
mask_ruin_xp: You strengthened or reinforced an ally.
mask_terror_desc: A terryfing visage to haunt the vampire
mask_terror_frighten_desc: When you Frighten, you instill fear into others.
mask_terror_awe_desc: When you Awe, you create a spectacle of wonder.
mask_terror_disarm_desc: When you Disarm, you remove an enemy’s ability to do harm.
mask_terror_explode_desc: When you Explode, you use your emotions or literal explosive devices to make things go boom.
mask_terror_nolords_desc: Gain +Effect when either soothing the souls of the oppressed or inspiring them to action.
mask_terror_fearyourslaves_desc: Gain +1d whenever you try to turn servants or followers against their master.
mask_terror_sowdiscord_desc: Gain +1d when you take a Set-Up action to terrify an enemy force, reducing their scale as combatants flee in terror.
mask_terror_noexcuses_desc: Gain +1d when you Awe a friendly group. You may grant them potency on a success.
mask_terror_shockawe_desc: If you perform a Desperate action, gain +Effect, as all are shocked and awed by your sheer audacity.
mask_terror_primalterror_desc: You may spend 2 essence to summon a small cohort of ravens, spiders, or rats that you can Command.
mask_terror_silencedfears_desc: You may expend Special Armor to cancel a consequence that increases your heat.
mask_terror_xp: You instilled terror into the heart of an oppressor.
mask_violence_desc: No mercy for the vampire. Only death.
mask_violence_slaughter_desc: When you Slaughter, you use close, personal violence.
mask_violence_carnage_desc: When you sow Carnage, you fight at a distance.
mask_violence_direct_desc: When you Direct, you command others in the heat of battle.
mask_violence_cover_desc: When you Cover, you use violence to protect your comrades.
mask_violence_taunt_desc: Gain +1d when taunting an enemy into focusing its attention on you.
mask_violence_threaten_desc: +Effect when using boasts, threats, and general shouting to intimidate your foes.
mask_violence_wholesalecarnage_desc: +Effect when using Carnage to fight a group that is at a larger scale than your own.
mask_violence_fleshmend_desc: You may use Special Armor to cancel a consequence of physical harm.
mask_violence_leadfromthefront_desc: Add +2 ticks to any morale clock of a cohort or allied group you personally lead.
mask_violence_bloodtaker_desc: Instantly gain 2 essence whenever you defeat a vampiric enemy. You do not need to spend essence to activate this ability.
mask_violence_seered_desc: Spend 2 essence to “see” the blood of everyone at your current location, even through walls, until the end of the scene.
mask_violence_xp: If you used violence to protect a comrade or ally.
mask_riot_desc: Speak in the language of the unheard
mask_riot_rouse_desc: When you Rouse, you inspire people to take action.
mask_riot_burn_desc: When you Burn, you set fire.
mask_riot_inspire_desc: When you Inspire, you fill hearts with passion or purpose.
mask_riot_provoke_desc: When you Provoke, your enemies do things they shouldn’t.
mask_riot_languageunheard_desc: Gain +Effect when you invoke a known cause or common struggle to stir others to action.
mask_riot_commonstruggle_desc: Gain +1d when gathering information by talking with a commoner.
mask_riot_friendscomrads_desc: Gain +Effect or +1d when addressing a crowd.
mask_riot_fieryrhetoric_desc: Whenever you deliver a speech, you may spend 2 essence to spontaneously cause something to catch on fire.
mask_riot_torchespitchforks_desc: Any crowds or cohorts you lead gain +Effect.
mask_riot_singlespark_desc: Gain +1d or +Effect to any arsons or explosions you help engineer.
mask_riot_righterwrongs_desc: You may invoke some crime, tragedy, or other horrible deed committed by the vampires to gain +1d or +Effect.
mask_riot_xp: You led others or spoke truth to power.
mask_torment_desc: The agony of action. The pains of freedom.
mask_torment_exsanguinate_desc: When you Exsanguinate, you draw blood or strength from another.
mask_torment_vivisect_desc: When you Vivisect, you use quick, precise blade strikes.
mask_torment_suture_desc: When you Suture, you repair people or things.
mask_torment_tend_desc: When you Tend, you care for your comrade’s needs.
mask_torment_lure_desc: Gain +1d when attempting to lure someone away or set up a future ambush.
mask_torment_astitchintime_desc: Gain +1d when repairing something or rigging up a trap
mask_torment_tormentinglaughter_desc: You may expend 2 essence to make a target hear mocking laughter coming at them in all directions.
mask_torment_sufferinsilence_desc: You may expend Special Armor to avoid being detected while doing violence.
mask_torment_expertvivisection_desc: Gain +1d when performing an autopsy to determine how someone died or when using blades to rend someone limb from limb.
mask_torment_thousandneedles_desc: You bid wounds stitch themselves closed. You may use Suture or Tend on a nearby group.
mask_torment_sharedpain_desc: You gain +1d or +Effect when trying to understand the pain of others or by invoking shared hardships.
mask_torment_xp: You cared for an ally either physically, emotionally or mentally.
mask_judgement_desc: Pass judgement and carry out the will of the many.
mask_judgement_snipe_desc: When you Snipe, you shoot at targets from long range.
mask_judgement_scout_desc: When you Scout, you move ahead to gather intelligence.
mask_judgement_read_desc: When you Read, you read and interpret writing or situations.
mask_judgement_slip_desc: When you Slip, you quietly fade away.
mask_judgement_executioner_desc: Gain +Effect or +1d when attacking a target that is badly wounded.
mask_judgement_reviewevidence_desc: Gain +1d when gathering information related to a specific target.
mask_judgement_carefulaim_desc: Gain +1d when shooting a target from a controlled position.
mask_judgement_pronouncesentence_desc: Your words carry the weight of democratic authority. Gain +1d when giving information to others or commanding them to action.
mask_judgement_swiftjustice_desc: When there is a question as to who acts first, you do.
mask_judgement_readroom_desc: You can always tell when danger is coming your way. The GM will warn you of upcoming danger, or provide you with a free flashback to prepare for it. This ability does not cost essence.
mask_judgement_xp: You pronounced your judgement on a situation or character.
+heavy_description: The addition of chain mail, metal plates, a metal helm
a_blade_or_two_description: Perhaps you carry a simple fighting knife. Or two curved swords. Or a rapier and stiletto. Or a heavy butcher’s cleaver.
a_large_weapon_description: A weapon meant for two hands. A battle-axe, greatsword, warhammer, or pole-arm. A hunting rifle. A blunderbuss. A bow or crossbow.
a_pistol_description: A heavy, single-shot, breech-loading firearm. Devastating at 20 paces, slow to reload.
an_unusual_weapon_description: A curiosity or tool turned into a weapon. A whip, a flail, a hatchet, a shovel, a length of chain, a razor-edged fan, steel-toed boots.
arcane_implements_description: A vial of quicksilver. A pouch of black salt. A spirit anchor in the form of a small stone. A spirit bottle. A vial of electroplasm, designed to break and splatter on impact.
armor_description: A thick leather tunic plus reinforced gloves and boots.
autofill_reminder_mask: To generate mask abilities and skills, enter the name of the crew type above:
autofill_reminder_playbook: To generate playbook abilities, items, and associates, enter the name of the playbook above:
background_info: Academic — Labor — Law — Trade — Military — Noble — Underworld
bolster: Bolster your crew's reputation or develop a new one.
burglary_gear_description: A set of lockpicks. A small pry-bar. Vials of oil to silence squeaky hinges. A coil of wire and fishing hooks. A small pouch of fine sand.
chat_image: Image to show alongside chat rolls
climbing_gear_description: A large coil of rope. A small coil of rope. Grappling hooks. A small pouch of chalk dust. A climbing harness with loops and metal rings. A set of iron pitons and a small mallet.
deity_features_info: Alluring — Cruel — Ferocious — Monstrous — Radiant — Sinister — Serene — Transcendent
demolition_tools_description: A sledgehammer and iron spikes. Heavy drill. Crowbar.
documents_description: A collection of slim volumes on a variety of topics, including a registry of the nobility, City Watch commanders, and other notable citizens. Blank pages, a vial of ink, a pen. A number of interesting maps.
express_crew: Express the goals, drives, inner conflict, or essential nature of the crew.
fill_fields: Fill in sheet fields automatically upon entering or changing playbook or crew type
flexible_width: Flexible character sheet width (adapts to container)
functions_info: to guard — to destroy — to discover — to acquire — to labor at ... that which my master commands.
gatherinfo_how_can_I_blend: How can I blend in here?
gatherinfo_how_can_I_get_them: How can I get them to [X]?
gatherinfo_what_can_I_tinker: What can I tinker with here?
gatherinfo_what_do_they_intend: What do they intend to do?
gatherinfo_what_do_they_really: What do they really care about?
gatherinfo_what_drives_them: What drives them to do this?
gatherinfo_what_echoes: What echoes in the ghost field?
gatherinfo_what_is_arcane: What is arcane or weird here?
gatherinfo_what_is_hidden: What is hidden or lost here?
gatherinfo_what_should_I_look: What should I look out for?
ghost_viceblurb: You have an intense need: life essence. To satisfy this need, possess a living victim and consume their spirit energy (this may be a downtime action). When you do so, clear half your drain (round down).
heritage_info: Akoros — The Dagger Isles — Iruvia — Severos — Skovlan — Tycheros
hull_viceblurb: Your clockwork body runs on electroplasm. Recharge your capacitors by connecting to an industrial-grade generator (downtime action). When you do this, clear 5 drain.
lantern_description: A simple oil lantern, a fancy electroplasmic lamp, or other light source.
list_masks: Lies, Ruin, Terror, Violence, Riot, Torment, or Judgement.
list_playbooks: Cutter, Hound, Leech, Lurk, Slide, Spider, Whisper, Ghost, Hull, or Vampire.
planningdesc: Players determine goal & opportunity, select an approach, provide the detail.
query_for_consequence: Query for consequence name when resisting
recoveryblurb: Get treatment in downtime to activate your healing project clock
resist_instructions: Suffer 6 stress minus the highest die result. When you roll a critical on resistance, clear 1 stress.
show_broadcast: Show broadcast buttons for sending information to chat
show_cohort_section: Show cohort section on character sheet
show_outline: Show outline for active input fields
strictures_bestial: When you suffer physical harm or overindulge your vice, your body twists into a horrific bestial form until you next feed without overindulging.
strictures_bound: Your spirit must remain in this body, or be destroyed.
strictures_forbidden: You cannot enter a private residence without permission from the owner.
strictures_repelled: Spiritbane charms can hold you at bay. (Take 2 stress to resist the repulsion.)
strictures_slumber: In downtime, you must spend one activity resting in a dark, silent place (or else suffer 3 stress).
stricturesblurb: When you gain a new vampire trait (except veteran), add a stricture.
subterfuge_supplies_description: A theatrical make-up kit. A selection of blank documents, ready for the forger's hand. Costume jewelry. A reversible cloak and distinctive hat. A forged badge of office.
tinkering_tools_description: An assortment for detailed mechanist work: jeweler’s loupe, tweezers, a small hammer, pliers, screwdriver, etc.
vehicle_edges_flaws:
Vehicle Edges
Nimble: The vehicle handles easily. Consider this an assist for tricky maneuvers.
Simple: The vehicle is easy to repair. Remove all of its harm during downtime.
Sturdy: The vehicle keeps operating even when broken.

Vehicle Flaws
Costly: Thee vehicle costs 1 coin per downtime to keep in operation.
Distinct: Thee vehicle has memorable features. Take +1 heat when you use it on a score.
Finicky: The vehicle has quirks that only one person understands. When operated without them, the vehicle has -1 quality.
vice_info: Faith — Gambling — Luxury — Obligation — Pleasure — Stupor — Weird
vice_instructions: Clear an amount of stress equal to the highest die result. If the result of your vice roll means you clear more stress levels than you had marked, you overindulge.
when_you_use_bandolier: When you use a bandolier slot, choose an alchemical:
zerodice: Zero Dice — take the lowest result above
